headline: Corpay (CPAY) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of business payments company Corpay (NYSE:CPAY) jumped 11.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter results and provided a strong outlook for 2026.

headline: Corpay's Q4 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates, Increase Y/Y
summary: CPAY tops Q4 estimates as EPS jumps 12.7% and revenues rise 20.7%, driven by strong vehicle and corporate payments growth, while lodging declines.

raw.headline: Corpay's Q4 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates, Increase Y/Y

headline: Corpay Refines Portfolio As PayByPhone Sale Highlights Corporate Payments Focus
summary: Corpay (NYSE:CPAY) has agreed to sell its PayByPhone unit to private equity firm Lightyear Capital. The deal is intended to streamline Corpay’s operations and reinforce its focus on corporate payments. The transaction represents a meaningful change in how Corpay allocates management attention and capital across its portfolio. Corpay, trading at $300.28, sits at an interesting point for investors watching payment specialists. The stock is down 22.7% over the past year, while the 3-year...

headline: CPAY Q4 Deep Dive: Acquisitions and Corporate Payments Drive Positive Momentum
summary: Business payments company Corpay (NYSE:CPAY) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.7% year on year to $1.25 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5.27 billion at the midpoint came in 0.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $6.04 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
